protocol.text: Arabidopsis seeds were surface-sterilized and germinated on an agar-solidified nutrient medium in Petri dishes. The nutrient medium was based on half Murashige-Skoog salts (MS) and the final pH was adjusted to 5,7. The seeds were vernalized at 4ºC for 2 d. Petri dishes were placed into a growth chamber, positioned vertically and kept under controlled environmental conditions at 22ºC and a 16/8 h day/night regime. After five days, seedlings were transferred to 1/2 MS plates containing BA (H3BO3, 5mM)
Trizol extraction of total RNA was performed according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Biotinylated aRNA were prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol from 0.5 ug total RNA (GeneChip® 3’ IVT Express Kit User Manuall, 2008, Affymetrix).
Following fragmentation, 10 ug of cRNA were hybridized for 16 hr at 45C on GeneChip® Arabidopsis ATH1 Genome Array. GeneChips were washed and stained in the Affymetrix Fluidics Station 450.
Array scanning was carried out with the GeneChip® scanner 300 and image analysis was performed using the GeneChip® Operating Software.
The data were processed and normalized by RMA using the R package known as “affy”.
